intro: Schizoglossum elingue subsp. purpureum, commonly known as the purple-flowered schizoglossum, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, branched stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. It is native to parts of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
